Posts.Content: Continued PSA maybe monthly? Bone and CT scan monthly? Monthly PSA is a good thing. A monthly SCan is very harsh, the Scan technician told me one scan is equivalent to 100 x-rays. Lets face it your body can only tolerate so much. I have noticed lots of problems in pelvic and abdomen region. Are these problems from all the scans; its got me thinking
Posts.Title: Need advice - PSA nuts again and what about PET/CT F-18 Fluciclovine (Axumin) scan

Posts.Content: Anyone here have any post radiation problems. My colon was taking the brunt of the rad treatments. I think its Radiation Proctitis hard to say at this point. Not serious but annoying if you know what I mean.
Posts.Title: Radiation Proctitis

Posts.Content: ================================================== = Seems like when someone posts something of any seriousness no one replies.... ================================================== = After all the things I haver read on this site and elsewhere on the Internet, you are better off to cut your nuts off stay away from any drugs as they are extremely dangerous, radiation is needed in some instances. Chemical Castration is harsh I have no more to add to that.
Posts.Title: Radiation Proctitis

Posts.Content: Forgot to mention that Radiation Proctitis is after the fact like 6-10 months down the road, I finished my treatments last July.
Posts.Title: Radiation Proctitis

Posts.Content: I was on HT drugs lastr year for about 6 months although the affects last about a year or more. I know my t level has come back my muscle mass is almost what it was 16 years ago. Feels good. But My stinkin PSA is going up waiting for my test end of this month. On another note I noticed my Penis shrunk maybe an inch during HT therapy. Really weird. Would I ever go back on HT drugs;.....? That is very debatable. 20% of me says yes and 80% says NOPE..!

Posts.Title: Testosterone's Effect on Prostate Cancer

Posts.Content: Wow, you guys are in good shape. My lower back does put a damper on many activities, but I try to hold my own just the same.
Posts.Title: Exercise - How much, what type and how long...?

Posts.Content: Just got my Lupron shot yesterday. Just wondering what you guys do for exercise. I usually go on the tread mill or go for a long walk, around 30mins on tread mill and 3 miles outside. I also work out on the weights for about 1/2 hour. Not sure how long I will be able to keep up becasue the drugs do take the wind out of the sails..... But on a positive note spring is arriving real quick, then summer so that will boost my metabolism. The Sun is my Drug................
Posts.Title: Exercise - How much, what type and how long...?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Bravehardon The important thing is that we keep exercising at something and dramatically limit how long we sit Understand how important exercise is, what about "dramatically limit how long we sit".........?
Posts.Title: Exercise - How much, what type and how long...?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Fairwind The PSA level and Velocity are equally important..Today, there are effective secondary treatments that can keep your cancer under control for a long time....It's time to start investigating them... Can you elaborate more on secondary treatments.
Posts.Title: PSA Result or Doubling Time

Posts.Content: Hello guys, I had a radical prosectomy back in 2011. Gleason score of 7 PSA before surgery 6.7 PSA after surgery .012 No outside margins Lymph nodes were clear Only 20% of prostate gland had cancer ED, although nerve function is good My PSA has slowly increased to .49 so the doctor now wants to put me on Hormone blockers. He said it has to be done before radiation treatment to get the PSA down to .10. I'am extremely freaked out about taking these drugs, the side effects are hideous. What is your guys take on this..?
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapy

Posts.Content: Yes but in my case I've had radical prostatectomy. Having said that from my research I noticed that most men now wait till they start hormone therapy. In othe words Watchfull.Waiting. And some men wait till the PSA reaches about 10.ng. Mine is only .47. My urologist did mention that its better to start the hormone therapy when it reaches .30.. Having said that what if the PSA rises substantially 3 years after all this. Sometimes the Cancer cells become drug resistant. In my case I have to see the Oncologist soon and take it from there. If my PSA drops quickly I may get off the Drugs and keep up with the blood tests before going full blown with the Drugs and Radiation. Having a low PSA and not to be Chemically Castrated I may enjoy my summer, even if its my Last. Those are my thoughts. And been only 57 I still have some youthfull Testosterone that gives me Life. I had my Testosterone level checked last year its down about 15-20% from say a 40 year old.

AgeInfo.Phrase: <Z> <Z> And been only 57 I still have some youthfull

Posts.Title: Hormone Therapy

Posts.Content: I have been on the Hormone pills for 3 days and I have to stop, the side effects are getting to much. Constipation big time, head aches, dizziness, sudden onset of tiredness and a couple minor ones. The constipation is big one for me beacuse I get that from taking meds for my back. I have to take something for my back ocassionally.
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapy

Posts.Content: Most definitely I will stay active especially for the better part of Summer. What I don't understand is that my Uroligist wants me take the pills for 2 weeks prior to having the hormone shot, then continue the pills for 2-3 months get the PSA level down and then have Radiation treatment. Is this the normal course of Action that most of you have encountered..?
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapy

Posts.Content: Thanks again guys, Thanks smroush for the heads up on your experience. I'm 57 by the way. My big concern is bone density but I guess extra Calcium and Vit -D will help for that. I have a bad lower back with 2 degenerative discs. One good thing about this is that I will be on Hormone therapy and Radiation maybe during the Summer and thats a good thing because I shine in the Summer months. The extra Vit-D from the Sun gives me a huge boost mentally and physically. From what I hear the density loss from Hormone therapy is ireversible. But I'm thinking if I work out big time after I off the hormone therapy I may gain my bone density back. You did have a Radical prosectomy..? How come you are still on the Hormones after one year..?
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapy

Posts.Content: Here is the kicker, which I was not aware of, the side-effects get worse for a while after the treatments are over. F$%K Cancer...
Posts.Title: Radiation side-effects

Posts.Content: Minor bleeding, pain in rectum, hemorrhoids, diarrhea, bloating.. there is more.. if it gets all the cancer then thats minor compared to what could be.
Posts.Title: Radiation side-effects

Posts.Content: Most of the side effects have subsided. Still get the bowel urgency , not as bad though. My Oncologist stated that Colo-rectal Cancer is possible after Rad Treatments. I just have to keep an eye on things as my stool color has changed and or not consistent as before the treatments,
Posts.Title: Radiation side-effects

Posts.Content: Have not tried Trimix so can't comment. But I have a question, how much does it cost..in Canada or US..?
Posts.Title: Issue of some sort with Trimix

Posts.Content: Have not tried Trimix so can't comment. But I have a question, how much does it cost..in Canada or US..?
Posts.Title: Issue of some sort with Trimix

Posts.Content: I had 6 months of the drugs. I later read that the Urologist stated in his report to my GP that not sure if the drug treatment has any Merritt. And my PSA is going up as I type. I feel ok so my PSA could be 20.0 I may have a Pet scan but thats where it ends. I have heard of other men that opted out of the drugs and just went for the radiation. From all the reasearch I have done the Hormone drugs do not kill the cancer cells but just merely by you time without the quality of life.
Posts.Title: Salvage Radiation and Hormone (Lupron) Therapy

Posts.Content: You need a dedicated bone scan for that. They inject this Phosphous stuff into a vien, then wait a few hours for it to circulated thru the skeleton.
Posts.Title: CT Scan

Posts.Content: Well Mikla glad to hear about your success. My situation is very similiar, Some nerve is missing. I leaked as well for about 4 months, still leak a little on ocassion but nothing drastic. This is after 2 1/2 years, 56 years old. Erections are non existence Other than that, my PSA level is rising now and have to go on Hormone therapy and Rad-Treatment.

AgeInfo.Phrase: This is after 2 1 2 years  56 years old <Z>

Posts.Title: Post Op - Two Weeks

Posts.Content: Well Mikla glad to hear about your success. My situation is very similiar, Some nerve is missing. I leaked as well for about 4 months, still leak a little on ocassion but nothing drastic. This is after 2 1/2 years, 56 years old. Erections are non existence Other than that, my PSA level is rising now and have to go on Hormone therapy and Rad-Treatment.

AgeInfo.Phrase: This is after 2 1 2 years  56 years old <Z>

Posts.Title: Post Op - Two Weeks

Posts.Content: There was a study done on ground water. Apparently tap water that lacks Selenium is not a good thing for those prone to PC. I did a small test before my surgery and drank water from a different town, my PSA was 6.7 it actullay went down to 6.3, now is this a coincidence..? not sure because since 2011 I have had about 12 PSA tests and all were rising except for some Post-op tests. But that test was the only one where it dropped. Selenium is thought to prevent free radical damage in the body. It's thought to help prevent cancer by affecting oxidative stress, inflammation and DNA repair..............foods that contain Selenium. 1.Brazil Nuts 2.Sunflower Seeds 3.Fish (tuna, halibut, sardines, flounder, salmon) 4.Shellfish (oysters, mussels, shrimp, clams, scallops) 5.Meat (Beef, liver, lamb, pork) 6.Poultry (chicken, turkey) 7.Eggs 8.Mushrooms (button, crimini, shiitake) 9.Grains (wheat germ, barley, brown rice, oats) 10.Onions
Posts.Title: Holistic approach

Posts.Content: I hope a few guys tune in on this topic. Just want to get some feedback on the pitfalls of not having surgery done and opting for Brachy Therapy instead. So the doctor gives you the option of Brachy Therapy or Radical pros. surgery, for arguemnts sake your Gleason is 7 PSA is 8 biopsy is 40% left lobe negative margins. You decide to have Brachy Therapy and all goes well except for some side effects of course, nothing unusall. Your PSA after 12 months has dropped to 0.04. My arguement is you still have the prostate gland, cancer will eventually return will it not..? My doctor also said that PSA tests after Brachy Therapy can be very eratic and not accurate as well as having a cemented prostate and other damaged tissue surounding the prostate. I opted for Surgery, it hopes of not having prior damage to the area. Make sense. It has to me allthough now I will be having Radiation Treatment. Not all of us get away lucky with just having surgery and been good for 20 years. The other argument is a lot of guys had only a Gleason of 6, which is not considered an urgent treatment situation. Most of these guys could probably just do Rad treatement and/or Hormone therapy and be fine in 20 years.
Posts.Title: Brachy Therapy vs. Surgery

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH My own case was a Gleason 6, so it may not have complete relevance here. For me, I'm glad that surgery was my best bet because it is currently the only way to know the true pathology of the prostate -- which gives a good idea of what to expect in the future. Take care, Chuck I think that pretty well sums it up for me. Having read all the posts there does not seem to be a clear and concise decision based on individual circumstances and the state of the cancer, after all its Cancer and who really know what the future holds.
Posts.Title: Brachy Therapy vs. Surgery

Posts.Title: Holistic approach

Posts.Content: Good luck in the OR. Don't know your husbands background but for the surgery was a cake walk. I had it done at 55 years I went in at 7am did the prep went down to OR around 8am, came to in recovery at around 10:30 am. Surgery went like gangbusters. The doctor said I have no fat tissue at all, which made it very easy for him to perform surgery and do an over all inspection of Lymph nodes etc... At any rate I was released the following day at 1pm. The worst part of this was the Biopsy and the pre-colon cleanse. The Catheter did not bother me much either other than been a nusisance. I could feel the tube inside when I had a bowel movement. As long foods are soft, stools are soft not a biggy. I had it removed in a week. The sutiries were a cake walk as well. Good luck.....

Posts.Title: Husbands surgery tomorrow

Posts.Content: Go on the no Wheat diet, it works. It helps big time with reducing inflammation and that is one of the biggest causes of many many diseases. I'm on it and it works.
Posts.Title: Will pomegranate juice effect PSA test

Posts.Content: Ok maybe they bullpoop on the TV but some medical professionals are stating that a high PSA is not necessarily a death sentence nor Cancer cells present. And many men are going the Organic diet way, this is what I'm doing. I have been living with PC for probably over 15 years. My PSA was high 17 years ago. Symptoms appeared about 7 years ago. 2011 surgery 2014 radiation and hormone deprivation drugs..... Current PSA 3.9. And dont tell me I'm dying becasue I feel the same I did 2 years ago. Actually I feel worse because the drugs have taken some wind out of my sails. At any rate I will treat myself my way not the conventional Doctor prescription method..!
Posts.Title: Over treatment

Posts.Content: Always get a Second opinion, no mater what...

Posts.Content: Seems like I have skin color changes around my groin area and losing some pubic hair. Is that from extreme ED. It has got worse since RT treatments. Only used the pump once in the last 2 1/2 months..... I guess I have to start using it more often is my guess.
Posts.Title: Treatment or Otherwise

Posts.Content: I gained about 18 pounds. So far I only lost 4-5# I finished the pills last July and the Lupron was starting to wear off around August. My Oncologist said you should bounce back around the Spring of 2015 and he was right. I noticed about 2 months ago that my Body odour was starting to smell bad. Seems normal now. I could not for the life of me do much with the weights it would give me a headache. All i could do was walk. Riding a bike was ludicrous when getting radiation and taking the drugs. It felt like I had a baseball up my arse after riding.
Posts.Title: Lupron and weight gain

Posts.Content: Your results are very close to mine. Did you have negative margins, clear vesicles and lymph nodes.?
Posts.Title: New Guy just diagnosed in 12/13

Posts.Content: Sounds like they are really making inroads to PC. My grandfather died frpm PC. Treatement 80 years ago was nil.
Posts.Title: New PC Blood Test

Posts.Content: I have to have my scans done and see what transpires.
Posts.Title: Which comes first rise in psa or pain at site of spread ?

Posts.Content: Yes, therefore Cancer is not cut and dry. Its different for every one. For me anyway I did feel some pain. I had an extreme attack about 4-5 years prior to surgery actually, kind of hard to describe but thats what it was (prostate cancer flair up)..! I just hope I did not wait to long. But like most men we ignore these aches and pains and sometimes its to late.
Posts.Title: Which comes first rise in psa or pain at site of spread ?

Posts.Content: Cialis did not work for me, besides it gave me a lot of back ache and it states that in the small instruction leaflet inside the pak. I told my GP that and he snickered and said that he never heard that before, I adamantly told him it is written..as such a side effect... Tell me what you think.
Posts.Title: Levitra vs Cialis

Posts.Content: Thanks, did not know about the quack symptom. I never thought that for a moment it would cure cancer and all other ailments, there are many books and articles in print about Colon health and the long road to a healthy life because of proper colon cleansing and nutrition. I guess we will wrap this one up. Originally Posted by ChemoMan Dr Hulda Clark died of cancer. So much for her cancer cures. Hulda Clark is the most well known quacks of the 20th century. Here is an article that treats her with the disdain she deserves: http://scienceblogs.com/insolence/20...quack-part-ii/ This woman is responsible for the early deaths of thousands of people, ironically enough including her own. C'est la vie
Posts.Title: Possible good Information regarding Cancer and general health

Posts.Content: I think taking any drugs for anything can have long term side effects. I use the mechanical methods , they work just a hassle is all. Taking Cialis or Viagra is like souping up an old car and not having the nuts and bolts to handle the extra power. Sooner or later something will give.
Posts.Title: No erection

Posts.Content: Someone told me that most men with Prostate Cancer can live for years............. who are they kidding once it is metastasized you only have about 2-4 months give or take and I know personally of this.
Posts.Title: High PSA coming back...

They are more accurate.

Posts.Content: "They find it much easier on the patient." this is where I'm at right now, taking HT meds now for 2 months. Will be on them for about another 3 months. Getting a PSA test soon; see wher that leads. Can you elaborate more on the "easier on the patient." part Brave..?
Posts.Title: Article on Hormone Therapy

Posts.Content: I found this site http://www.phoenix5.org from a post on here. At any rate somewhere on phoenix5 was a searchable page with case histories submitted by users. I cannot find it again. Does anyone know where it is..? Update on Rad Treatment and Hormone drugs. PSA down to .21 after 1 month down from .70. So far have had 9 rad zappers. Going for 32.
Posts.Title: Looking for link

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Replicant Maybe you're thinking about Yananow.net with its survivor stories? Lol........yes you are 100% right on. Getting the (brain flake) these days. This is expected been on lupron injections and hormone pills. Any way live life don't give up on life because of cancer, live and let live. Laugh like you never laughed before, tomorrow may be cut short. As long as you are walking live....!
Posts.Title: Looking for link

Posts.Content: Well I had my Bone Scan done, its negative. Next week I will find out what my CT scan results are. But so far I can tell you that as my post op PSA was rising I could feel a slight pain the odd time in the same place as where the prostate was. So having said that I will have Radiation at a later date which will be focused at the bed of the prostate if every thing else is clear.
Posts.Title: Which comes first rise in psa or pain at site of spread ?

Posts.Content: I looked at this site and it may shed some light on health issues in regards to parasities and other disorders. Let me know what you think..?
Posts.Title: Possible good Information regarding Cancer and general health

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by mikem350 Could you please clear something? If the scans are clear, how do they know where to irradiate? Radiation is suggested based on rising psa alone? How high is psa now, and your pain level? Am very curious because I am 8 wks post op and my psa is higher now, and may have to repeat the scans too. 8 wks post op with rising PSA is a concern to be taken up with your doctor. I had surgey 3 years ago. My PSA has risen to .49 in December 2013, normally they recommend radiation before it gets to 1.0. The Cancer according to the scans has not gone beyond the prostate region. But only time will tell. I could have metasaes in the lungs but the scans will never show that. My pain level is nill, taking Hormone drugs. I feel fine except for side effects from medication. I also had negative margins. But some of the cells are very agressive, this is what they found after the post op biopsy.
Posts.Title: Which comes first rise in psa or pain at site of spread ?

Posts.Content: Correct me if I'm wrong but over the years I always heard that when surgery is performed there is a chance of Cancer escaping like migrating to other areas of the body. What is your guys take on this...? I have heard horror stories from other Cancer folks that had surgery and post surgery showed no cancer present then 6mos to a year later Cancer spread like wild fire. Some urologists decline PC surgery based on late tests and later finding out that the patient had a high Gleason score and PSA so surgery is declined because chance of it Spreading. .....
Posts.Title: Surgery Problems

Posts.Title: Treatment Assumptions based on ...???..

Posts.Content: No removal of Lymph nodes, Bone Scan negative, but PSA is 0ver 80. MMmmmm will have a pelvic scan I guess. Like I said the drugs lowered the PSA the radiation seemed to do nothing, After drug treatment the PSA was rising at the same rate before Rad treatment, so this tells me the Cancer was never in the Prostate Bed. This concerns me..! And the Biopsy was very evasive , what you guys think sticking that probe up there poking around ...is it not quite possible that Cancer cells escaped, and during surgery is it not possible that cancer cells could escape. ?? If I dont get any answers here nor the Doctors where do I get the right answers...?

Posts.Title: Here we go again...

Posts.Content: So I had surgery in 2011 then PSA rising to about 3.4 by 2014 Received Radiation at the prostate bed. since then PSA has risen at the same rate as it did after surgery. Supposedly the cancer is somewhere but where..? The PSA was lowered before the Radiation with hormone therapy drugs to about .12 1) HAving said that I received over 30 rounds of Radiation therapy directed at the prostate bed to no Avail..? 2) If the radiation did not kill the cancer this must mean that it spread beyond the prostate bed and it was not there after the surgery. I'm confused has anyone else run into this situation.?
Posts.Title: Radiation Treatment

Posts.Content: I tred Cialis only twice and both times my lower back stiffened up. And I have lower back issues in a big way. My MD seemed to chuckle about it and said I have heard of very few side effects. At any rate drugs are not allways the answer. Some of the long term effects using Viagra are cardio-vascular problems as well as eye sight. Not this cowboy, I would rather live with a limp noodle than have heart and eye issues..

Posts.Content: I tried Cialis did not like, it caused big time back ache and never did get an erection.
Posts.Title: Cialis Effects

Posts.Content: A lot of controversy lately about the over treatment off certain cancers in particular PC. A high PSA is not always a 100% indicator that PC is present nor overly aggressive. So many doctors want to give out prescriptions for cancer drugs and evasive scans and tests. If it aint broke dont fix it...! My experience a good diet and alternative approach like herbs or Marijuana. In search of better quality of life. Heroin is a better option. Lupron sucks Balls
Posts.Title: Over Treatment

Posts.Content: Not going into great detail here, but I started Hormone therapy about a month ago, side effects vary from person to person. The best thing to say is I'm on a level now, it takes about 20-30 days or so for the drugs to kick in. Just getting some minor hot flashes now, a little insomnia, some tiredness. I would possibly consider Castration on a second go around of the drugs for the simple fact that castration has fewer side effects than the drugs. My doctor tells there are drugs to use after Castration if high PSA levels return.

Posts.Title: Scans

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Fairwind There are different kinds of "Hormone Shots"...The ones used to treat PC are not hormones at all. They are drugs that suppress testosterone to very low levels..Chemical Castration....The side effects are the same as physical castration.. Is physical castration the same as Chemical Castration..? .............the Drugs have to be worse, they are a foriegn substance going into your body like any other drug only worse than most drugs. I have done much research and most say that physical castration has fewer side effects compard to any Chemical. And if you are on the Hormone drugs for any lenght of time the cancer can become resistant to those drugs. I would thing the less drugs the better, I would want the drugs to work if the cancer came back in later years of my life. Then they would put you on Chemo drugs, whats worse Chemo drugs or HT..

Posts.Title: Stopping hormone therapy after PSA undetectable for two years?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Michael F Great & Fantastic news CV!!! Congrats! Can you share with us your PSA history pre and post treatment? It will be useful to all of us who are in The Protracted Post Treatment PSA "Watch & Wait" Mode. Enjoy the achievement! MF I'am not going thru my docs, but as far as I recall my Gleason was 4+3. Pre op PSA was 6.7, negative margins, only left side of prostate was positive. Post surgery PSA was .02 then went to about 1.1 after 18 months or so. In 2014 April PSA was .04 pre radiation and during hormone therapy. Received hormone drugs for 6 months. I will have another PSA test next month. Currently I sit at 2.0 PSA.
Posts.Title: Recent Tests

Posts.Content: Thanks guys.... cheers and have good weekend.
Posts.Title: Scans and Xrays

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by newporter Michael F did right by asking for your history. Are you sure your current PSA is 2.0? If so, I am sorry to say this, your current PSA of 2.0 after salvage radiation and hormone therapy indicated the cancer is still there, though in amount small enough that scans could not pick them out. The good news is the cancer can likely be managed and controlled so they won't do much damage for a while. Best wishes. Yep its 2 but I heard other men are higher than that and managing just fine without Evasive drugs or treatment. Time will tell . It can still fluctuate after treatment its only been one year. I stopped the drugs in August and they still lingered till this spring. PSA is not the best indicator of Cancer.

PatientDecided.Sample: Don't know your husbands background but for the surgery was a cake walk. I had it done at 55 years I went in at 7am did the prep went down to OR around 8am, came to in recovery at around 10:30 am...."So, did you have any lymph nodes tested? " No, what kind of test is involved..? When I went for surgery he stated that the lymph nodes in that region were clear upon observation....For me, I'm glad that surgery was my best bet because it is currently the only way to know the true pathology of the prostate -- which gives a good idea of what to expect in the future. Take care, Chuck I think that pretty well sums it up for me....Some urologists decline PC surgery based on late tests and later finding out that the patient had a high Gleason score and PSA so surgery is declined because chance of it Spreading. ........I had it done at 55 years I went in at 7am did the prep went down to OR around 8am, came to in recovery at around 10:30 am. Surgery went like gangbusters....Apparently tap water that lacks Selenium is not a good thing for those prone to PC. I did a small test before my surgery and drank water from a different town, my PSA was 6.7 it actullay went down to 6.3, now is this a coincidence..? not sure because since 2011 I have had about 12 PSA tests and all were rising except for some Post-op tests....How high is psa now, and your pain level? Am very curious because I am 8 wks post op and my psa is higher now, and may have to repeat the scans too....I did a small test before my surgery and drank water from a different town, my PSA was 6.7 it actullay went down to 6.3, now is this a coincidence..? not sure because since 2011 I have had about 12 PSA tests and all were rising except for some Post-op tests. But that test was the only one where it dropped....What is your guys take on this...? I have heard horror stories from other Cancer folks that had surgery and post surgery showed no cancer present then 6mos to a year later Cancer spread like wild fire. Some urologists decline PC surgery based on late tests and later finding out that the patient had a high Gleason score and PSA so surgery is declined because chance of it Spreading....My arguement is you still have the prostate gland, cancer will eventually return will it not..? My doctor also said that PSA tests after Brachy Therapy can be very eratic and not accurate as well as having a cemented prostate and other damaged tissue surounding the prostate. I opted for Surgery, it hopes of not having prior damage to the area....Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH My own case was a Gleason 6, so it may not have complete relevance here. For me, I'm glad that surgery was my best bet because it is currently the only way to know the true pathology of the prostate -- which gives a good idea of what to expect in the future...." No, what kind of test is involved..? When I went for surgery he stated that the lymph nodes in that region were clear upon observation. Am I missing something that should of been tested prior to surgery and prior to having Radiation to the Prostate bed based on the likelihood of cancer cells been present in that area when in fact my PSA was rising at the same rate After Radiation....I opted for Surgery, it hopes of not having prior damage to the area. Make sense....
